‚ÄúM√≠nimo sou,

DRAWING WORKSHOP FOR ADULTS
For anyone with no prior drawing experience but with the desire to express themselves through it. All you need to bring is your enthusiasm and good energy‚ÄîI‚Äôll take care of the rest.
In my drawing workshops for adults, I focus on the creative process, where drawing is a journey of self-expression and discovery rather than just a final result. I aim to create a safe and inspiring space that values creative freedom, experimentation, and authentic expression, without the constraints of pre-established rules or the fear of making mistakes.
These workshops invite you to explore the unique connection between yourself and your lines, experiencing drawing as a form of personal and reflective communication. I encourage each participant to embrace mistakes as opportunities for growth, to stimulate creative thinking, and to rediscover the joy of creating without judgment.
If you‚Äôre looking for a space of sharing, freedom, and creativity‚Äîwhere you can break free from limiting beliefs and appreciate your own way of seeing and feeling the world‚Äîthese workshops are for you. Come celebrate differences, build confidence, and discover the power of drawing as a tool for personal and artistic transformation.

Freedom Candlemaker constructs a celestial journey with his fusion of dreamy, esoteric pop with nu-folk, psychedelic and shimmery soundscapes.

text_sinopse.en:
Gavin Friday is an Irish singer-songwriter, actor and painter, best known as a founding member of the post-punk group Virgin Prunes.
In the red-walled library of Gavin Friday‚Äôs home in Dublin city centre, a sacred heart hangs from the white ceiling. The glass totem was a welcome gift when Friday returned to the city centre about two years ago; it presides there as a reminder of his past and a lure for his future. Friday, now 64, began questioning Catholicism more than half a century ago, when he wondered why the teachers at his strict Catholic school, so-called servants of God, beat him and his classmates. This was just before witnessing the rise of glam and punk, before seeing Joy Division for the first time or crossing the Irish Sea to catch David Bowie in London. This was also just before he started the Virgin Prunes, his canonically transgressive post-punk band that scrambled perceptions of gender. And this was just before the acts of rebellion and questioning that created his singular career as a singer, songwriter, visual artist and actor merged into an astonishingly creative life. But there are some symbols and some stories that you can‚Äôt get over ‚Äì or that you really don‚Äôt want to. ‚ÄòMaybe I haven‚Äôt grown up,‚Äô he says beneath the sacred heart, winking. ‚ÄòOr maybe I am growing up.‚Äô
This alternation and tension animate Ecce Homo, Friday‚Äôs first album in 13 years and a captivating culmination of the life he has lived and the life he is now determined to build for himself. Driven alternately by thundering electronica reminiscent of the power of the Prunes and exquisite acoustics that reflect the beauty of his latest solo work and soundtracks, Ecce Homo is an ecstatic, no-holds-barred expression of anger and independence, of separating ourselves from the stereotypes of what we‚Äôre supposed to be, while recognising that our toughest battles are often the collective ones. There are love songs and fight songs, reflections on loss and reveries of nostalgia, hymns to solidarity and excoriations of the powerful. Friday reckons this is the most honest album he‚Äôs ever made; it‚Äôs also the most fascinating.
text_sinopse.all:
Gavin Friday √© um cantor e compositor irland√™s, ator e pintor, mais conhecido como membro fundador do grupo p√≥s-punk Virgin Prunes.

Na biblioteca de paredes vermelhas da casa de Gavin Friday, no centro de Dublin, um cora√ß√£o sagrado est√° pendurado no teto branco. Friday, agora com 64 anos, come√ßou a questionar o catolicismo h√° mais de meio s√©culo, quando se perguntou porque √© que os professores da sua r√≠gida escola cat√≥lica, ditos servos de Deus, batiam nele e nos seus colegas. Isto foi mesmo antes de assistir √† ascens√£o do glam e do punk, antes de ver Joy Division pela primeira vez ou de atravessar o mar da Irlanda para apanhar David Bowie em Londres. Isto tamb√©m foi pouco antes de come√ßar os Virgin Prunes, a sua banda p√≥s-punk canonicamente transgressora que baralhou as percep√ß√µes de g√©nero. E isto foi mesmo antes de os actos de rebeli√£o e interroga√ß√£o que criaram a sua carreira singular como cantor, compositor, artista visual e ator se terem fundido numa vida espantosamente criativa. Mas h√° alguns s√≠mbolos e algumas hist√≥rias que n√£o se podem ultrapassar ‚Äì ou que n√£o se quer mesmo ultrapassar. ‚ÄúTalvez eu n√£o tenha crescido‚Äù, diz ele por baixo do cora√ß√£o sagrado, piscando o olho. ‚ÄúOu talvez esteja a crescer.‚Äù

Essa altern√¢ncia e tens√£o animam Ecce Homo, o primeiro √°lbum de Friday em 13 anos e um culminar cativante da vida que ele viveu e da vida que est√° agora determinado a construir para si. Conduzido alternadamente por uma eletr√≥nica estrondosa que lembra o poder dos Prunes e por uma ac√∫stica requintada que reflecte a beleza do seu mais recente trabalho a solo e das bandas sonoras, Ecce Homo √© uma express√£o ext√°tica e sem limites da raiva e da independ√™ncia, de nos separarmos dos estere√≥tipos do que √© suposto sermos, ao mesmo tempo que reconhecemos que as nossas batalhas mais dif√≠ceis s√£o frequentemente as colectivas. H√° can√ß√µes de amor e can√ß√µes de luta, reflex√µes sobre a perda e devaneios de nostalgia, hinos √† solidariedade e escoria√ß√µes aos poderosos. Friday considera que este √© o √°lbum mais honesto que alguma vez fez; √© tamb√©m o mais fascinante.

Ap√≥s o sucesso das edi√ß√µes anteriores, o Mr. Bean's Music Club e a Pontas Soltas t√™m o prazer de anunciar uma nova s√©rie de concertos intimistas, novamente limitada a 50 pessoas.

Em Fevereiro de 2025 lan√ßar√° o seu primeiro longa-dura√ß√£o ‚ÄúE o Espet√°culo Continua‚Äù, que conta com a produ√ß√£o de Domingos Coimbra (Capit√£o Fausto), grava√ß√£o de Diogo Rodrigues (Ganso, Luis Severo) e edi√ß√£o da Cuca Monga.

Random Reference - Regular Classes at The Alchemist
First Class - 22nd Of March

Random Reference finds itself between all my movement practices. The non-definition of a practice allows me to create synergies among styles within an urban/contemporary cloud. I gradually boil bodies through improvisation, absorbing phrases and techniques along the way.

When & Where?
The first class will happen on the 22nd of March, at The Alchemist's top floor, situated on Rua Formosa 325.
The class has a duration of two hours, from 11h - 13h.
Bring comfy apparel, water and something to eat during a short break if needed.

About me:
Born in Porto, Duarte graduated ESD in 2014. He researches both contemporary & urban practices, a movement study he refers to as Random Reference. Duarte worked with choreographers such as Marco da Silva Ferreira, Jonas & Lander, Gregory Maqoma, Emmanuelle Hyuhn, Drosha Gherkov, Mafalda Deville, Thierry Smits and Catarina Miranda.
Choreographed Rubble King in 2021, nominated by SPA Autores in 2022, and is in the process of creating Placa M√£e and Turbo Escape with Cac√° Otto Reuss.

4 Class Bundle ‚Äì 35‚Ç¨
If your situation doesn‚Äôt allow you to afford the full price of this class, send me a DM ‚Äì I still want you to come.

text_sinopse.en: In an era marked by profound social, environmental and political challenges, the 2025 edition will focus on the role of art and literature as forms of resistance and regeneration. Based on the premise of creating platforms for inter- and transmedial dialogue, the Days will feature communication and performance proposals that problematise the multiple intersections between poetry and performance in the context of crises (social, environmental, political) and the search for more sustainable and inclusive futures. As in previous editions, this aims to be an opportunity to strengthen links between researchers and society in general, promoting inter-institutional collaboration initiatives.

"Sei das pedras parideiras h√° j√° muito tempo, mas s√≥ agora √© que elas atravessaram o meu caminho para me ajudar a gritar alto: Pedra que pariu!

Para l√° da simplicidade dos materiais e dos gestos que comp√µem as pe√ßas apresentadas, est√£o v√°rias camadas de diferentes estados de emo√ß√£o e consci√™ncia. Est√° ainda a dureza do trabalho que se faz em sil√™ncio, de forma demorada, e que reclama nada mais do que a sua exist√™ncia por si s√≥ ‚Äì existir para ser contemplado.

Im√≥veis, r√≠gidas, gran√≠ticas e milenares, depois de s√©culos de trabalho invis√≠vel e silencioso, as pedras parideiras tamb√©m d√£o √† luz." ‚Äî Rita Senra

text_sinopse_en.en:
I‚Äôve known about the birthing stones for a long time, but only now have they crossed my path to help me shout out loud: Pedra que pariu!

Beyond the simplicity of the materials and gestures that make up the pieces presented are several layers of different states of emotion and consciousness. There is also the harshness of the work that is done in silence, over a long period of time, and which claims nothing more than its bare existence ‚Äì to exist in order to be contemplated.

Immobile, rigid, granitic, and millenary, after centuries of invisible and silent work, the birthing stones also give birth.

text_sinopse.en:
What is Time? An illusion. A creation. A non-linear design. Derrida and Agamben explore the concepts of Time, through the symbols of the Child and the Ghost. These archetypes speak to us of potentiality, spectrality, past, future and memory, pulling us ‚Äì yet and paradoxically ‚Äì to the present moment which is what really exists. Inspired by the legacy of both philosophers, ‚ÄúThe Child and the Ghost‚Äù proposes, through the work and artists, a vision of time and subjectivity that is neither linear nor fixed, an interpretation of duality and the dialogue between these elements. Are we constantly crossing thresholds and borders‚Äîbetween language and silence, between presence and absence, between potency and act?
üñº Artwork by Lara Costa, Mariana Alves de Sousa, Rita Fugaz and Simbraz

Estes arqu√©tipos falam-nos da potencialidade, da espectralidade, de passado, de futuro e de mem√≥ria, puxando-nos, ainda assim e paradoxalmente, para o momento presente, que √© o que realmente existe. Inspirada no legado de ambos os fil√≥sofos, ‚ÄúA Crian√ßa e o Fantasma‚Äù, prop√µe, atrav√©s da obra e dos artistas, uma vis√£o do tempo e da subjetividade que n√£o √© linear nem fixa, uma interpreta√ß√£o da dualidade e do di√°logo entre estes elementos. Estamos constantemente a atravessar limiares, limites e fronteiras‚Äîentre linguagem e sil√™ncio, entre presen√ßa e aus√™ncia, entre pot√™ncia e ato?

text_sinopse.en:
Seeing the world outside, holding hands or with arms wide open, occupying the squares and looking into the eyes of those facing us.

To do so - inspired by Francis Al√øs‚Äô ‚ÄúChildren‚Äôs Games‚Äù series, like a big ricochet - I propose a meeting in the streets whose sole purpose is to play, collectively. Ver o mundo l√° fora para que possamos ver melhor c√° dentro." ‚Äî Rita Senra

text_sinopse.en:
Eureka #5 - "Hierarchies of Time and Space"

The cosmos, immeasurable. Objects ever more distant are detected, on the edges of the universe‚Äôs expansion, which are also its beginnings, in magnitudes entirely detached from our mundane existence. Simultaneously, a single, tiny, and so proximate drop of water contains a universe of organisms, each composed of molecules, atoms, subatomic particles, at the edges of elemental matter, testing the boundaries of imagination. Various forms of this correlation thread through history, fueling everything from ancient myths to the self-similarity of fractals. How does one continue to express the infinite, the timeless?

text_sinopse.en: A historical representative of Cuba's great popular music, Eliades Ochoa visits us with his distinctive interpretation of son, characterized by flawless dialogues between his voice and the tres (a traditional guitar), of which he is one of the most revered performers. His latest album, Guajiro (Peasant), reaffirms the rural roots of this musician from Santiago de Cuba while expanding his influences to include bolero, Puerto Rican plena, Dominican merengue, and American blues. Ochoa's global fame was cemented with his participation in the Buena Vista Social Club album and film, following a solid artistic journey with the Cuarteto Patria. Nearly three decades later, he showcases his creative vitality with new music that builds bridges to the future while remaining deeply rooted in his traditions, origins, and life experiences. An irresistible taste of Cuban music in a concert that also celebrates the great songs of the past.

text_sinopse.en:
Able Noise are a cross-continent duo based between The Hague (NL) and Athens (GR), built around the experimental baritone guitar and drum playing of George Knegtel and Alex Andropoulos. After a few formative attempts at collaboration, they officially came together as the Able Noise we see now in 2017, uniting over shared thoughts on art and performance encountered while studying at The Royal Academy of Arts in The Hague. Their first recorded work, a seamless 30 minutes of glistening post-rock anti-formalism, emerged in low-key fashion in 2020 as a cassette through Glasgow‚Äôs famed GLARC label. Numerous European wide tours and left-of-centre festival appearances led the pair back to the studio for the recording of debut LP, High Tide, to be released via World of Echo on 1st November.



The shift to a studio environment was a significant one, since Able Noise was primarily conceived as a live band, thinking of and writing for the live concert experience specifically. Consider their practice an Active Performance of sorts, one that seeks to challenge understandings of the medium of the live arena, how its properties and limitations can be addressed creatively, and the dialogical relationship between performer and the audience. Those who have caught them live will have witnessed very physical yet malleable performances, shaped each time by the context at hand, be that the time of day, the acoustic properties of the space, and the shared energy of the assembled patrons.

Carlos Paredes is certainly the most well-recognised musician on the Portuguese guitar. It's therefore not surprising that in the centenary year of his birth, there is a proliferation of tributes.

In this week's Hora de Ponta, the public is invited to understand the legacy of this and other virtuoso musicians of an instrument that has always known how to emancipate itself from its position between the voices of fado and silence.

Hora de Ponta is a weekly activity organised by Fonoteca Municipal do Porto (FMP). Every Wednesday, between 6pm and 7pm, the public is invited to visit this space to an informal get-together and to listen to a selection of records associated to a specific theme.

DRAWING WORKSHOP FOR ADULTS
For anyone with no prior drawing experience but with the desire to express themselves through it. All you need to bring is your enthusiasm and good energy‚ÄîI‚Äôll take care of the rest.
In my drawing workshops for adults, I focus on the creative process, where drawing is a journey of self-expression and discovery rather than just a final result. I aim to create a safe and inspiring space that values creative freedom, experimentation, and authentic expression, without the constraints of pre-established rules or the fear of making mistakes.
These workshops invite you to explore the unique connection between yourself and your lines, experiencing drawing as a form of personal and reflective communication. I encourage each participant to embrace mistakes as opportunities for growth, to stimulate creative thinking, and to rediscover the joy of creating without judgment.
If you‚Äôre looking for a space of sharing, freedom, and creativity‚Äîwhere you can break free from limiting beliefs and appreciate your own way of seeing and feeling the world‚Äîthese workshops are for you. Come celebrate differences, build confidence, and discover the power of drawing as a tool for personal and artistic transformation.

text_sinopse.en: "Ivana Chubbuck technique has arrived to Portugal and we are hosting acting workshops  in March in Porto! Ivana Chubbuck is one of the most sought-after acting coaches in Hollywood who has worked with Oscar-winning actors such as Brad Pitt, Halle Berry, Charlize Theron, Sylvester Stallone and many others. Her technique focuses on using emotions and personal experiences as a fuel for the character's urgency to win, thus creating a strong, dramatic character that captivates the audience! Chubbuck workshops will be held on Thursdays in March from 6 to 9pm. We will be doing monologues and partner scenes. This is your chance to upgrade as an actor, nail your next audition and win your first lead role. We will be doing exercises that help you connect with the character and create a powerful performance. You will be asked to memorize the script and bring your own props. You will learn how to overcome stage fright and use your personal history to create a character the audience loves to watch. The workshop is open to English-speaking applicants over 18, with or without acting experience. To apply, please send an email with basic info about yourself to chubbuckmaya@gmail.com." ‚Äî Maya Dukic

The municipal Days with Energy programme is a weekly initiative that offers free pilates, yoga and tai chi classes on Saturday mornings. Known for his introspective rhymes and melancholic beats under his producer alias dj blackpower, MIKE has been solidifying his status since 2015 as one of the most distinctive and influential rappers and producers of recent times. Born in New Jersey and shaped between London and the Bronx, his music carries the marks of each city he's lived in. From the energy of London grime to the dark lyricism of New York, MIKE has created a unique sound that places him among the greats. His repertoire includes collaborations with artists like The Alchemist, Earl Sweatshirt, Larry June, Navy Blue, and Sister Nancy. z√© menos, formerly known as Kap, is Jos√© Po√ßas‚Äîsound engineer, singer, and music producer. In 2019, he released the album o ch√£o do parque, a project entirely self-produced. In May 2024, z√© returned with the EP quatro partos, a collaborative project with six tracks produced by Pedro, o Mau, and written and performed by z√© menos. Known for his expressive facial and body language, his performances are synonymous with introspection and catharsis.

PLACIDO | PL√ÅCIDO

Luis Garc√≠a Berlanga | ESP | 1961 | 85‚Äô


Nomeado para o √ìscar de Melhor Filme em L√≠ngua Estrangeira, Pl√°cido √© uma das obras mais √°cidas de Luis Garc√≠a Berlanga, desenvolvida em colabora√ß√£o com o argumentista Rafael Azcona, respons√°vel por algumas das propostas mais extravagantes de cineastas como Marco Ferreri ou Carlos Saura. Este c√°ustico retrato da sociedade franquista, do seu regime e da institucionaliza√ß√£o de um cristianismo de estado, Pl√°cido denuncia a hipocrisia, a falsa caridade e o culto das apar√™ncias. O filme concentra-se numa noite em que o protagonista Placido √© obrigado a participar num desfile de Natal com a sua lambreta de tr√™s rodas ainda por pagar, tendo escapado milagrosamente √† censura por ter sido recebido √† √©poca como uma ‚Äúcom√©dia coral inofensiva‚Äù.

Lucinda Childs √© um nome maior da dan√ßa p√≥s-moderna americana e figura incontorn√°vel da hist√≥ria das artes performativas contempor√¢neas. O seu importante corpo de trabalho coreogr√°fico distingue-se pela singularidade da linguagem coreogr√°fica, reconhec√≠vel na estrutura complexa e abstrata das suas pe√ßas e no vocabul√°rio empregue, de movimento restrito.


Os Early Works, apresentados em duas galerias do Museu de Serralves, s√£o uma cole√ß√£o de pe√ßas que abrangem o per√≠odo de evolu√ß√£o criativa desta core√≥grafa e bailarina seminal, situado entre 1963 e 1979, e integram as ideias axiais e fundadoras da sua obra art√≠stica.


Este programa-trajet√≥ria conjuga uma das suas primeiras investiga√ß√µes a solo que recorre a adere√ßos, realizada durante a sua inscri√ß√£o na gera√ß√£o Judson Dance Theater, o seu primeiro solo Past Time, e os Silent Works (pe√ßas dan√ßadas em sil√™ncio) - Particular Reel, Calico Mingling, Reclining Rondo, Radial Courses e Katema, as primeiras pe√ßas produzidas para a sua Companhia, que fundou em 1973, e que notabilizaram Childs pelas suas especificidades formais e conceptuais.


A t√≥nica destas pe√ßas assenta no ritmo e na geometria, bem como no corpo que se move no espa√ßo. text_sinopse.en: It was 15 years ago that The Legendary Tigerman released Femina, a conceptual album exploring themes such as love and desire and their undeniable complexity, always balancing delicately between rawness and tenderness, between the visceral and the fantastical. DRAWING WORKSHOP FOR ADULTS
For anyone with no prior drawing experience but with the desire to express themselves through it. All you need to bring is your enthusiasm and good energy‚ÄîI‚Äôll take care of the rest.
In my drawing workshops for adults, I focus on the creative process, where drawing is a journey of self-expression and discovery rather than just a final result. I aim to create a safe and inspiring space that values creative freedom, experimentation, and authentic expression, without the constraints of pre-established rules or the fear of making mistakes.
These workshops invite you to explore the unique connection between yourself and your lines, experiencing drawing as a form of personal and reflective communication. I encourage each participant to embrace mistakes as opportunities for growth, to stimulate creative thinking, and to rediscover the joy of creating without judgment.
If you‚Äôre looking for a space of sharing, freedom, and creativity‚Äîwhere you can break free from limiting beliefs and appreciate your own way of seeing and feeling the world‚Äîthese workshops are for you. Come celebrate differences, build confidence, and discover the power of drawing as a tool for personal and artistic transformation.

text_sinopse.en: Gabriella Iacono and Gregory Grosjean trace a history of dance through iconic choreographies that they recreate using only their hands. A ballet for two bodies and four hands, with miniature scenographies filmed live and projected on a large screen, consisting of twelve frames. In each frame, the hands dance key works by 20th-century choreographers such as Vaslav Nijinsky, Maurice B√©jart, Pina Bausch or Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker, and explore the great stages from Broadway to Paris, from Brussels to Harlem, including ballet, musicals, the dance marathons of the 1930s, rock, contemporary dance or hip-hop. Em cada quadro, as m√£os dan√ßam obras-chave de core√≥grafos do s√©culo XX, como Vaslav Nijinsky, Maurice B√©jart, Pina Bausch ou Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker, e percorrem os grandes palcos, desde a Broadway at√© Paris, de Bruxelas ao Harlem, passando pelo bal√©, os musicais, as maratonas de dan√ßa dos anos 30, o rock, a dan√ßa contempor√¢nea ou o hip-hop. text_sinopse.en:
'Le jour il fait nuit' is the title of the upcoming exhibition at Kubik Porto, a project by Andr√© Cepeda that brings together a group of artists whose works have never been presented in the city. Cepeda's connection with these artists is marked by a strong emotional bond, either from having worked with them at his Blues Studio or from having met them in other circumstances within the art circuit. Cepeda's Ciclo da Cobra project has been shown in other spaces, proposing a relationship between music and art. Now, at Kubik Porto, the exhibition features artists such as: Adriana Jo√£o, Ana Almeida, Anne Lefebvre, Cristiana Ortiga, Diogo Sim√µes, Fala Mariam, Leonardo Martins, Marta Mateus, Mariana Maia Rocha, Miguel Proen√ßa, Pedro Leit√£o, Rui Moreira. The show will also include a concert by Fala Mariam 3 and a performance by Adriana Jo√£o on the opening day.

This group of artists engages in dialogue within the exhibition, establishing a connection between them. What is visible is a form of resistance and discontent with current times, expressed through the art they create and the encounters they promote with each other.

The title of the exhibition, Le jour il fait nuit, is taken from a text written by Al Berto on April 16, 1986, in homage to the death of Jean Genet, titled "Jean, o pescador do suquet". The text was published in the introduction of the book O Est√∫dio de Alberto Giacometti, by Jean Genet, edited by Ass√≠rio & Alvim, in Lisbon, in 1988.

Take part in the 11th edition of BioBlitz at Serralves! A vibrant event that combines science, art and nature, celebrating the park's biodiversity with Lipor. From March 31 to April 4 for schools and from April 5 to 6 for families, come and explore the fauna and flora in an educational and unforgettable adventure!

The BioBlitz is an educational and scientific event of reference in the field of education and awareness of Biodiversity, which introduces the fauna and flora of Serralves Park through the exploration of scientific and artistic methodologies. Based on a contemporary narrative, this event is part of the Sustainability Agenda, highlighting the Sustainable Development Goal of the 2030 Agenda, ‚ÄúProtect Earth's Life‚Äù and is part of the celebration of the 20th anniversary of the Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, the first global multidisciplinary initiative developed to assess the consequences of changes in ecosystems, with a view to their conservation and sustainable use.

A unique opportunity to learn about biodiversity through a diverse program in Serralves Park, an invitation for everyone to take part!

Find out more at bioblitz.serralves.pt

text_sinopse.en: Yoseli has a tattoo of the Eiffel Tower on her back and has always wanted to travel, but she was arrested at the airport for drug trafficking. Nacho is a trans man who was arrested for swindling and started a rock band in jail. Gentle or rough, blonde or shaved, cis or trans, long-term inmates or newly admitted: in this hybrid musical, they all re-enact their lives in a Buenos Aires prison. Reas is a collective work that reinvents the musical genre: the performers dance and sing about their past in prison, relive their life as fiction, and invent, through fantasy and imagination, a possible future for themselves.

_title.all: Alentejo singular ‚Äî Ecos da nossa flora

text_sinopse.en:
"Singular Alentejo: Echoes of our Flora"

Discover the beauty and diversity of Alentejo flora through this unique exhibition. "Alentejo Singular" celebrates the natural richness of our region, highlighting the plants that shape the landscape and local culture. Each watercolor on display is an echo of our botanical heritage, inviting visitors to explore and appreciate the deep connection between nature and the Alentejo identity.

The exhibition offers a visual tour, where colors, details and shapes intertwine to discover the life that almost always passes beneath our feet, in the city, but especially in the countryside.

From the wildflowers that paint the fields in spring to those that endure in the gardens and parks of cities, towns and villages, each watercolor is a tribute to the beauty and uniqueness of our habitats and our landscape.
We hope that this exhibition inspires a new perspective on the flora of Alentejo and promotes the conservation and appreciation of this natural heritage. Enjoy every detail and let yourself be enveloped by the echoes of our flora.

Desde as flores silvestres que pintam os campos na primavera at√© aquelas que resistem nos jardins e parques das cidades, vilas e aldeias, cada aguarela √© uma homenagem √† beleza e √† singularidade dos nossos habitats e da nossa paisagem.

text_sinopse.en: It was as a member of Loosegoats, a cult band in the alt-country movement of the ‚Äò90s, that the name Christian Kjellvander first started to become known. After the Swedish ‚Äì though their hearts were firmly planted in the vast South-western American plains ‚Äì quartet broke up, Kjellvander initiated a solo career that would turn out to be quite fertile. Since his debut, Songs From a Two-Room Chapel (Startracks, 2002), he has already released ten full-length albums, revealing a deep-voiced troubadour as concerned by the misadventures of the heart as he is by those that plague humanity. His emotional authenticity serves as the connecting point between our most intimate desires and the grandiose power of nature. The culmination, so far, of this trajectory has been the sublime Hold Your Love Still (Tapete, 2023), a record that showed better than ever before the diversity included in Kjellvander‚Äôs rich palette of inspirational resources. Above all, all through his work, the Swede has been an evocative storyteller in the very best tradition of Leonard Cohen: whether cynically dismantling capitalist culture (Disgust For The Poor), in singer/songwriter love song mode (Terns Took Turns), or even freely using for analogy material some geographical references of a youth that was very connected to the Iberian Peninsula (Portugal, Cultural Spain), each of his songs is always delivered with the same subtle passion, turning his artistic canon into a true travel map, be they literal or figurative. But always leaving a mark. ‚Äî Amplificasom
text_sinopse.all: Foi como membro dos Loosegoats, banda de culto do movimento do country alternativo dos anos 90, que o nome Christian Kjellvander se come√ßou a fazer conhecido. Com a separa√ß√£o do quarteto sueco ‚Äì ainda que de cora√ß√£o plantado nas vastas plan√≠cies do Sudoeste norte-americano ‚Äì, Kjellvander lan√ßou-se numa carreira a solo que se veio a revelar bastante f√©rtil. Desde a estreia com Songs From a Two-Room Chapel (Startracks, 2002), s√£o j√° 10 os √°lbuns longa-dura√ß√£o de um trovador de voz profunda e expressiva, que tanto aborda as maleitas do amor como as que assolam a humanidade, com uma autenticidade emocional que serve de fio condutor entre os nossos √≠ntimos desejos e o poder da natureza. O culminar, at√© agora, desta trajet√≥ria, foi Hold Your Love Still (Tapete, 2023), que exp√¥s como nunca a diversidade inclu√≠da na vasta paleta vasta de recursos inspiracionais de Kjellvander. text_sinopse.en: Los dias afuera is a musical documentary theatre piece and the second part of the film Reas. The performance narrates the lives of six people from the moment they get out of prison, crossing their biographies in an album of unpredictable stories. Meanwhile Nacho works as a driver in cab apps and play in a rock band, Paulita works in a clandestine textile workshop singing cumbia and Noelia pays her living doing sex work and organize kiki-balls and demos for trans visibility. All of them have served their sentences and now they are trying to rebuild their lives, but they are facing the barrier of their criminal records. ‚Äî Lola Arias

text_sinopse.en:
"Have you always wanted to give shape to your imagination but don't know where to start? In 5 sessions, I will take you to the enchanted world of illustration and creative writing, where you will learn different manual printing techniques such as monotype, and blind drawing exercises, disproportion inserted into geometric figures, exercises with ink and line to discover shapes, and much more. You will discover your type of illustration and your story with the help of letters and objects that will awaken your creative side. Illustration and creative writing is a magical combination that will serve to unlock within you that message that you have long wanted to decode. Symbolism will be present in the shapes and words that you choose. Illustration and writing can have a symbolic, metaphorical, figurative, sentimental or even poetic character. It's up to you!

text_sinopse_en.all:
‚ÄòSt John's Passion‚Äô, BWV 245 by Johann Sebastian Bach
Porto Cathedral Choir will be performing Johann Sebastian Bach's ‚ÄòSt John's Passion‚Äô, BWV 245, this year during Holy Week. The performers will be the Porto Cathedral Choir, the Atlantic Orchestra and five soloists (Marta Martins | Soprano; Ana Santos | Alto; Fernando Guimar√£es | Tenor; Job Tom√© | Baritone; Lu√≠s Pereira Rendas | Baritone), under the direction of Tiago Ferreira.
‚ÄòSt John Passion‚Äô (BWV 245) is a sacred oratorio composed by J.S. Bach in 1724. This masterpiece is a dramatic representation of chapters 18 and 19 of the Gospel according to St John, in which the Passion of Christ is narrated. It is recognised for its emotional depth and musical complexity. The work is structured in recitatives, choruses, ariosos and arias, which together create a powerful and engaging narrative about the last moments of Jesus Christ's life.
Compared to the ‚ÄòPassion according to St Matthew‚Äô, the ‚ÄòPassion according to St John‚Äô is often described as more intense and expressive, with a more dynamic tempo. Bach's music in this work not only illustrates the biblical text, but also evokes a wide range of emotions, from pain and suffering to hope and redemption.
This is a concert of great cultural and spiritual value, offering attendees a unique opportunity to experience one of the most important works of sacred music.

"Portos. Portas. Pontes. is a multi-venue exhibition showcasing works by young Porto-based artists from around the world. Hosted in newly opened venues led by fellow expatriates, this initiative fosters artistic exchange between Porto‚Äôs expat and local communities, creating opportunities for cultural dialogue and collaboration. By transforming spaces into dynamic artistic environments, the project enriches the city‚Äôs creative scene and provides a platform for fresh perspectives.

Inspired by the journey of migration, the exhibition draws on the symbolism of ports, doors, and bridges to create opportunities for emerging artists, offering visibility and engagement for young expatriate talent. Ports connect us through art, welcoming new encounters. Doors open pathways to creativity and community. Bridges unite, fostering dialogue and collaboration.

Each participating venue offers a distinct theme, shaping an immersive experience for visitors through exhibitions, workshops, and events.

The exhibition will feature work by young international artists who each bring their unique stories and creative visions to life through diverse mediums: Nicolai Ganichev, Maxence Pons, Destiny, Vlad Aldohin, Yin Liu, Mulvaney, Anton Prokopev

All exhibited artworks are available for purchase."

Ser√£o int√©rpretes o Coro da S√© Catedral do Porto, a Orquestra do Atl√¢ntico e cinco solistas: Marta Martins | Soprano; Ana Santos | Alto; Fernando Guimar√£es | Tenor; Job Tom√© | Bar√≠tono; Lu√≠s Pereira Rendas | Bar√≠tono, sob a dire√ß√£o de Tiago Ferreira.

A Paix√£o segundo S√£o Jo√£o (BWV 245) √© uma orat√≥ria sacra composta por J. S. Bach em 1724. Esta obra-prima √© uma representa√ß√£o dram√°tica dos cap√≠tulos 18 e 19 do Evangelho segundo S√£o Jo√£o, em que se narra a Paix√£o de Cristo, sendo reconhecida pela sua profundidade emocional e complexidade musical. A obra √© estruturada em recitativos, corais, ariosos e √°rias, que juntos criam uma narrativa poderosa e envolvente sobre os √∫ltimos momentos da vida de Jesus Cristo.

Comparando com a Paix√£o segundo S√£o Mateus, a Paix√£o segundo S√£o Jo√£o √© frequentemente descrita como mais intensa e expressiva, com um andamento mais din√¢mico. A m√∫sica de Bach nesta obra n√£o s√≥ ilustra o texto b√≠blico, mas tamb√©m evoca uma ampla gama de emo√ß√µes, desde a dor e o sofrimento at√© a esperan√ßa e a reden√ß√£o.

Concerto de elevado valor cultural e espiritual, proporcionando aos assistentes uma oportunidade √∫nica, vivenciando uma das obras mais importantes da m√∫sica sacra." ‚Äî Coro da S√© Catedral do Porto

text_sinopse_en.all:
‚ÄòSt John's Passion‚Äô, BWV 245 by Johann Sebastian Bach
Porto Cathedral Choir will be performing Johann Sebastian Bach's ‚ÄòSt John's Passion‚Äô, BWV 245, this year during Holy Week. The performers will be the Porto Cathedral Choir, the Atlantic Orchestra and five soloists (Marta Martins | Soprano; Ana Santos | Alto; Fernando Guimar√£es | Tenor; Job Tom√© | Baritone; Lu√≠s Pereira Rendas | Baritone), under the direction of Tiago Ferreira.
‚ÄòSt John Passion‚Äô (BWV 245) is a sacred oratorio composed by J.S. Bach in 1724. This masterpiece is a dramatic representation of chapters 18 and 19 of the Gospel according to St John, in which the Passion of Christ is narrated. It is recognised for its emotional depth and musical complexity. The work is structured in recitatives, choruses, ariosos and arias, which together create a powerful and engaging narrative about the last moments of Jesus Christ's life.
Compared to the ‚ÄòPassion according to St Matthew‚Äô, the ‚ÄòPassion according to St John‚Äô is often described as more intense and expressive, with a more dynamic tempo. Bach's music in this work not only illustrates the biblical text, but also evokes a wide range of emotions, from pain and suffering to hope and redemption.
This is a concert of great cultural and spiritual value, offering attendees a unique opportunity to experience one of the most important works of sacred music.

text_sinopse.en: Ana Lua Caiano brings traditional music into the realm of electronics, drawing on everyday sounds, harmonies, and canons, as well as synthesizers and beat machines. She composes, plays, sings, and produces. A true one-woman band, she is an artistic reference for new generations. However, now the challenge is different: how will her music behave within the context of a large ensemble? Given that jazz is particularly open to the fusion of different languages, and considering we are talking about Orquestra Jazz de Matosinhos, it is not difficult to anticipate the success of this encounter.

Mas agora o desafio √© diferente: como se comportar√° a sua m√∫sica no contexto de um grande ensemble? text_sinopse.en: The Giants of the Mountain [I giganti della montagna], Pirandello's last play, was interrupted by the author's death. It is this idea - that everything that happens on stage is unfinished - that Victor Hugo Pontes works on in his new creation. Through this work, we learn that life, even that which can only be seen on stage, can only be a dream and that each of us, transformed on stage, can be a dream artist. With the company Dan√ßando com a Diferen√ßa, the work focuses on the boundaries between truth and illusion, but also laughter and tears. Os Gigantes (The Giants), with an unfinished title, like the play from which it is based, will be a collective dream. - Victor Hugo Pontes

S√£o imaginados estes desenhos?! Sim, e por isso exp√µem-se incompletos. Mal acabados. Bem parecidos (!?), mas equ√≠vocos, quanto ao que mostram e, pior ainda, quanto ao parecem mostrar. Por estes motivos, voltamos a desenh√°-los. Continuamos a refaz√™-los, repetidas vezes, em s√©rie. Isto porque, depois de esquecidos, reaparecerem: voltam a aparecer.¬†

E √©, tamb√©m, como a reevoca√ß√£o de desenhos¬†n√£o feitos¬†e, por isso, ainda que mal-vistos e mal-parecidos, imaginados a aparecer.¬†
Para ser breve, tudo o que √© desenho (provisto de) nestes desenhos √© reevoca√ß√£o de desenhos¬†n√£o-feitos. Porque s√£o desenhos feitos pela exig√™ncia dos n√£o feitos. Feitos por falta desses¬†n√£o-feitos¬†que faltam (mal-imaginados?!) e pela exig√™ncia dessa mesma falta (possibilidade, desejo).
O que se exp√µe n√£o s√£o, portanto, obras feitas. Previne-se o p√∫blico: h√° muitos desenhos¬†em falta: desenhos a que falta¬†o feito¬†e os efeitos, apesar de tudo. Falta a pr√°tica, e na pr√°tica, como se diz. Mas estes desenhos, ¬´mesmo outros¬ª, existem, inoperantes, sem obra. Dissemelhantes como os astros e, tal como eles, despovoados.

The municipal Days with Energy programme is a weekly initiative that offers free pilates, yoga and tai chi classes on Saturday mornings. In the autumn and winter periods, the sessions take place in three municipal pavilions; in the spring and summer months, the classes take place outdoors, in municipal parks, and are also held on Sundays.

All the activities are planned and guided by physical education professionals and are open to people of any age and level of experience.

Participation is free, but registration is required by email: desporto@agoraporto.pt by 5pm each Friday.

SATURDAYS

Fontes Pereira de Melo Municipal Pavilion

09h00: Pilates

_title.all: [Festival DDD] - Durarei por Paz e Nunca por Mal

text_sinopse.en:
TimeConfluenceExpectationSharing

¬© Jo√£o Catarino

There are infinite paths, long straights that translate into long journeys of endless waiting. Waiting is always implicit in the process of beginning and in the duration after the start, and durability is a consequence of our need for time and for the body‚Äôs place in that time: How do we occupy it? How do we materialise the need to inhabit a path? In Durarei por Paz e Nunca por Mal [I Shall Last for Peace and Never for Evil], M√©lanie Ferreira and Daniel Matos design a device in which the audience is invited to be close and to wait for a contemplative path from above, where solitude and strength are at the centre of a work process that builds possibilities for images or their complete absence, without ever abandoning the body, the space and the future. We suggest a path of individual waiting for something that will always be better shared. ‚Äî M√©lanie Ferreira & Daniel Matos 

The Depend√™ncia Aberta project, by M√©lanie Ferreira, consists of choosing creators with whom she wants to spend time researching and creating, in a format of greater proximity, while at the same time inverting the format of creators choosing the performers. These invitations for collaboration appear because M√©lanie Ferreira believes that the creative act has to be true, intelligent, intense and promising and, not being able to take it on alone, she decides to make her body survive through someone else's head. There is thus an assumption of dependence and a need for coaching so that the existence of this performing body can have even more meaning and reach a purer state; without this requiring the dependency to be closed on the other. It is rather an open dependence, where both bodies neutralize, converge and renew each other. Therefore, being in the process of creating a solo is assuming that ‚ÄúI continue to lose myself in my body, so that reconfiguring is necessary and precise, so that the return is the novelty and the constant present.‚Äù
text_sinopse.all:
Existem caminhos infinitos, retas longas que se traduzem em percursos demorados de esperas infind√°veis. A espera est√° sempre impl√≠cita no processo de come√ßo e na dura√ß√£o p√≥s-in√≠cio, sendo a durabilidade consequ√™ncia da necessidade que temos do tempo e do lugar do corpo nesse tempo: como √© que o ocupamos? Como √© que concretizamos a necessidade de habitar um caminho? Em Durarei por Paz e Nunca por Mal, M√©lanie Ferreira e Daniel Matos desenham um dispositivo onde o p√∫blico √© convidado a estar perto e a esperar um caminho contemplativo a partir de cima, onde a solid√£o e a for√ßa s√£o o centro de um processo de trabalho que constr√≥i possibilidades de imagens ou a sua aus√™ncia por completo, sem nunca abandonar o corpo, o espa√ßo e o futuro. Prop√µe-se um caminho de espera individual por alguma coisa que ser√° sempre melhor partilhada. ‚Äî M√©lanie Ferreira & Daniel Matos


O projeto Depend√™ncia Aberta, de M√©lanie Ferreira, consiste em escolher criadores com os quais tem vontade de passar tempo de pesquisa e cria√ß√£o, num formato de maior proximidade, ao mesmo tempo que inverte o formato de serem os criadores a escolher os int√©rpretes. Estes convites de colabora√ß√£o aparecem porque M√©lanie Ferreira acredita que o ato criativo tem de ser verdadeiro, inteligente, intenso e promissor e n√£o sendo capaz de o assumir sozinha, decide fazer o seu corpo sobreviver pela cabe√ßa de outrem. H√° assim o assumir de uma depend√™ncia e uma necessidade de um coaching para que a exist√™ncia deste corpo performativo possa ter ainda mais significado e atinga um estado mais puro; sem que para isto, a depend√™ncia tenha de ser fechada no outro. √â antes uma depend√™ncia aberta, onde ambos os corpos se neutralizam, confluem e renovam. Assim sendo, estar num processo de cria√ß√£o de um solo √© assumir que ‚Äúcontinuo a perder-me no meu corpo, para que o reconfigurar seja necess√°rio e preciso, para que o voltar seja a novidade e o constante presente.‚Äù.

_title.all: The House is a Museum of Details

text_sinopse.all:
"A casa de um arque√≥logo, mais do que de um arquiteto"; "um museu de detalhes". ‚Äî Estes foram alguns dos coment√°rios sobre a casa que Ricardo Severo construiu em 1904 como seu primeiro trabalho no Porto, na Rua do Conde (hoje Rua Ricardo Severo). Rapidamente tornou-se uma refer√™ncia no debate sobre a "casa portuguesa" e a arquitetura neocolonial brasileira. Arque√≥logo, etn√≥logo, te√≥rico da arquitetura e engenheiro, Severo incorporou elementos das tipologias habitacionais tradicionais de diferentes regi√µes do pa√≠s neste edif√≠cio, transformando a casa onde viveu com a fam√≠lia num "modelo" antes de partir para o Brasil.

Reaberto h√° poucos meses, o Palacete Severo voltou a ser um espa√ßo de experimenta√ß√£o como Hotel Galeria, lan√ßando exposi√ß√µes de artistas contempor√¢neos promovidas pela filial portuguesa da Perspective Galerie de G√©raldine Banier. O projeto consiste em confiar a diferentes curadores a sele√ß√£o de obras de artistas contempor√¢neos para uma exposi√ß√£o que se revela por todo o Palacete Severo, incluindo o jardim.

O novo ano inicia-se com uma exposi√ß√£o com curadoria da historiadora de arte, Francesca Comisso, que desenvolveu um projeto estreitamente relacionado com a hist√≥ria deste local e em di√°logo com os seus espa√ßos, entre o edif√≠cio antigo e o novo: o jardim com as suas √°rvores centen√°rias, o p√°tio interno, os sal√µes atualmente utilizados como bar, restaurante ou biblioteca, os quartos e o spa.

text_sinopse_en.en:
"The house of an archaeologist rather than an architect", "a museum of details".

These were some of the comments regarding the house that Ricardo Severo built in 1904 as his first work in Porto, on Rua do Conde (now Rua Ricardo Severo). It soon became a landmark in the debate on the "casa portuguesa*" and Brazilian neocolonial architecture. An archaeologist, ethnologist, architectural theorist, and engineer, Severo incorporated elements from traditional housing typologies from different regions of the country into this building, turning the house where he lived with his family into a "model" before leaving for Brazil.

Reopened a few months ago, Palacete Severo has once again become a space for experimentation as a Gallery Hotel, launching exhibitions of contemporary artists promoted by the Portuguese branch of G√©raldine Banier's Perspective Galerie.
The project involves entrusting different curators with the task of selecting works by contemporary artists for a diffuse exhibition throughout the Palacete Severo, including the garden.

The new year opens with an exhibition curated by art historian Francesca Comisso, who developed a project closely related to the history of this location and in dialogue with its spaces, between the old and the new building: the garden with its ancient trees, the inner courtyard, the salons now used as a bar, restaurant, or library, the rooms, and the spa.

text_sinopse.en:
The Inujima and Imabari projects represent two distinct sides of the Japanese architectural practice SANAA and the independent practices of its founders Kazuyo Sejima and Ryue Nishizawa, whose 30 year-long partnership is celebrated through this exhibition. 

Constantly thinking about architecture in its environment, SANAA‚Äôs typological studies become means of learning, a slow incremental process by which the work connects to those inhabiting their designs. The study is the underlying framework holding together two projects operating in physical proximity but very different political and cultural landscapes. 


The Inujima project is a long-term engagement with a typical landscape of post-industrial Japan. The island was formerly home to more than 4,000 people at the start of the 20th century but suffered severe depopulation after the closure of local quarries ‚Äì only about 30 households remain today. From its inception in 2008, the Inujima Project is an ongoing collaboration of Kazuyo Sejima with curator Yuko Hasegawa and the Fukutake Foundation ‚Äì that views the island as a place of care, aiming to sustain it as a living entity by weaving art and cultural activities into the fabric of everyday life, fostering a convivial and sustainable community ecosystem. This exhibition brings together contributions by Kazuyo Sejima, Ryue Nishizawa and others who work together to nurture and sustain Inujima as a hospitable living landscape. 

The Imabari project is an office building designed for the Imabari Shipbuilding Corporation at a shipyard near the Inujima Island. The conception of this softer and more open work environment ‚Äì part of an effort to attract workers to the shipyard ‚Äì enables a closer relationship between workers across the building. Presented in its morphological development across several studies and iterations, the interest in overlapping connections across the building emerges gradually over a two-year period. Imabari‚Äôs multiple cell-like evolutions are featured in a landscape of small pedestals designed by SANAA, alongside pieces of furniture designed by Kazuyo Sejima and Ryue Nishizawa. 


Against radically different backgrounds, these projects come from an extended practice over time, guided by a methodology of continuous learning and adaptation that sees architecture as coextensive with the environment it shapes.

O interesse transversal por liga√ß√µes sobrepostas surge gradualmente ao longo de um per√≠odo de dois anos, expondo-se aqui o seu desenvolvimento morfol√≥gico atrav√©s de v√°rios estudos e itera√ß√µes. As m√∫ltiplas evolu√ß√µes de Imabari apresentam-se √† semelhan√ßa de n√∫cleos celulares, num cen√°rio de pequenos pedestais desenhados pelo atelier, juntamente com outras pe√ßas de mobili√°rio concebidas por Kazuyo Sejima e Ryue Nishizawa.

text_sinopse.en:
The exhibition explores how scientists, philosophers, writers, artists and filmmakers represent plants for scientific study or enjoyment, creating herbaria of a scientific and poetic nature.

Through a multidisciplinary approach, the exhibition presents the exploratory work of various botanists and artists.

Outside, on the Porch of the Barn and Lagar, the work of Mario Alberto Pedraza is presented, who documented Colombian orchids based on the collections of Alexander von Humboldt (1769-1859) and Aim√© Bonpland (1773-1858), made at the beginning of the 19th century

In the Barn's contemplative space, visitors are invited to discover the impressive Grand Herbier d'Ombres/Grand herbarium of shadows by Lourdes Castro (1930-2022), presented in the installation Je/Eux d'Ombres by artist Claudia Isabel Navas. In this space, Philippe Durand surprises with Boscs, cyanotypes featuring various species of flora from contemporary French Mediterranean regions. This reflective journey is further enhanced by a corridor lined with yellow flowers from the Andes, photographed by Ram√≥n Laserna, and by the sound of excerpts from Jean-Jacques Rousseau's eight Lettres de Botanique [Letters on the Elements of Botany].

At the Lagar, the exhibition looks at the first techniques for representing plants, from hand-collecting during the botanical expeditions of the 18th century to plant prints, hand drawings and the first photographs. Here, illustrations from the Real Expedici√≥n Bot√°nica (1783-1816) are presented, led by Jos√© Celestino Mutis (1732-1808), who inspired Ram√≥n Laserna's reflections on the fragility of the natural world. His work follows in the footsteps of Mutis, who hosted Humboldt and Bonpland in Santa Fe de Bogot√° in 1801. In this space, there is also a video installation on Impressions de Plantes [Impressions of Plants], a herbarium containing the plants collected in the Americas by these historical figures.

The exhibition includes the Botany Photography Collection of the University of Coimbra, highlighting the contributions of figures such as J√∫lio Augusto Henriques (1838-1928). In addition, the unique watercolours of Portuguese orchids by Ursula Beau (1906-1984) celebrate Portuguese biodiversity.

text_sinopse.en:
LABIA builds a universe that transcends individual and bodily materiality, undoing the colonising and binary language, offering discourses based on its gesture, and expanding its multiple possibilities in an endless artistic and life process. LABIA is durational performance-installation, and the audience can move around, enter and exit the room.

text_sinopse.en: The indigenous populations of the Amazon keep the forest standing. And what keeps their spirit alive? _title.all: Ma mort sera petite, comme moi

text_sinopse.en:
A banquet, an odyssey

¬´‚Ä¶The exhibition "Ma mort sera petite, comme moi" is a celebration of life, of desire, of pleasure. We can view it as a banquet, an odyssey.
Sebasti√£o Casanova‚Äôs paintings bring with them the odour of oil paints and the aroma of the meals that gave rise to them. We sense the scent of a stew, the flavour of a grilled lobster, the memory of a plate of mussels, savoured with an Alvarinho wine. Family scenes, meetings with friends, nights of revelry: the narrative that emerges from this exhibition is related to a bohemian existence, where the theme of community takes centre stage. The artist is part of the group of artists of Caldas da Rainha, a city where the most stimulating art scene in Portugal has emerged over recent decades.
There is also a significant existential dimension t Sebasti√£o Casanova's work: the reflection that he proposes to us is about ends ‚Äì of life, art and time - synthesised in the concept of epoch√©, found in Edmund Husserl's phenomenological philosophy. The "presupposition less" philosophy of Husserl and modernist painting, aims to search for a more authentic experience of reality. Both the philosopher and modern art, challenge conventional ways of seeing and interpreting, proposing a rupture with mental and aesthetic habits. While Husserl suspends judgements in order to reach the philosophical essence, modern artists have suspended traditional techniques in order to reveal new possibilities for expression.
Sebasti√£o Casanova is an heir to an absolutely modern cultural lineage. In his work I discern points of contact with Pierre Bonnard (the table), C√©zanne (still lifes), Morandi (idem), Broodthaers (the mussels), Daniel Spoerri (frozen meals) and Rirkrit Tiravanija (relational aesthetics). In our conversations, the artist mentioned other influences, above all from the fields of photography - Cindy Sherman, Jeff Wall, Catherine Opie, Philip-Lorca diCorcia - and cinema - Peter Greenaway, Sergio Leone, Paolo Sorrentino, Luis Bu√±uel or the opening scene of Enzo Barboni‚Äôs ‚ÄúThey Call Me Trinity‚Äù (1970), in which the gunfighter gulps down a huge plate of beans, accompanied by a large chunk of bread, straight from the frying pan.
Sebasti√£o Casanova's paintings are food for thought ‚Äì as a critique of the haute bourgeoisie, of the grotesque dimension of reality and of the social landscape.
His painting prefers to drift rather than stay in the living room. Everything is resolved in the kitchen. Around a plate of lentils or a prawn a√ßorda (bread-based stew)‚Ä¶¬ª

√ìscar Faria
text_sinopse.all:
Um banquete, uma odisseia

¬´‚Ä¶A exposi√ß√£o ‚ÄúMa mort sera petite, comme moi‚Äù √© uma celebra√ß√£o da vida, do desejo, do prazer. Podemos v√™-la como um banquete, uma odisseia. As pinturas de Sebasti√£o Casanova trazem consigo quer o cheiro do √≥leo das tintas, quer o das refei√ß√µes que lhes deram origem. Delas emana o perfume de um refogado, o sabor de uma lagosta grelhada na brasa, a mem√≥ria de um prato de mexilh√µes degustado com um vinho alvarinho. Cenas familiares, encontros com amigos, noites de farra: a narrativa que sobressai desta mostra est√° relacionada com a bo√©mia, onde o tema da comunidade assume um papel de destaque ‚Äì o artista faz parte do bando das Caldas, cidade onde, nas √∫ltimas d√©cadas, se formou aquela que √© a mais estimulante cena art√≠stica nacional.
Nos trabalhos de Sebasti√£o Casanova existe tamb√©m uma relevante dimens√£o existencial: a reflex√£o que o artista nos prop√µe √© acerca dos fins ‚Äì da vida, da arte, dos tempos ‚Äì sintetizados no conceito de epoch√©, origin√°rio da filosofia fenomenol√≥gica de Edmund Husserl. A ‚Äúsuspens√£o de pressupostos‚Äù partilhada entre Husserl e a pintura modernista, tem como inten√ß√£o a busca de uma experi√™ncia mais aut√™ntica da realidade. Ambos, o fil√≥sofo e a arte moderna, desafiam modos convencionais de ver e interpretar, propondo uma ruptura com h√°bitos mentais e est√©ticos. Enquanto Husserl suspende ju√≠zos para alcan√ßar a ess√™ncia filos√≥fica, os artistas modernos suspenderam t√©cnicas tradicionais para revelar novas possibilidades de express√£o.
Sebasti√£o Casanova √© herdeiro de uma linhagem cultural absolutamente moderna. Na sua obra consigo discernir pontos de contacto com Pierre Bonnard (a mesa), C√©zanne (as naturezas mortas), Morandi (idem), Broodthaers (os mexilh√µes), Daniel Spoerri (as refei√ß√µes congeladas) e Rirkrit Tiravanija (a est√©tica relacional). Nas nossas conversas, o artista referiu outras influ√™ncias, sobretudo da fotografia ‚Äì Cindy Sherman, Jeff Wall, Catherine Opie, Philip-Lorca diCorcia ‚Äì e do cinema ‚Äì Peter Greenaway, Sergio Leone, Paolo Sorrentino, Luis Bu√±uel ou a cena incial de Trinit√° ‚Äì Cowboy Insolente (Enzo Barboni, 1970), na qual o pistoleiro come uma gigantesca dose de feij√µes, acompanhado por um n√£o menos volumoso p√£o, directamente da frigideira.
Uma cr√≠tica da alta burguesia, do grotesco da realidade, da paisagem social contempor√¢nea, a pintura de Sebasti√£o Casanova √© um alimento para o esp√≠rito. Ela prefere a deriva √† sala de estar. √â na cozinha que tudo se resolve. √Ä volta de um prato de lentilhas ou de uma a√ßorda de camar√£o‚Ä¶¬ª

We invite you to join us for two-and-a-half hours of life-drawing, sharing and learning at the amazing space of Atelier de Arte Realista do Porto.

We provide all kinds of materials for drawing, (you are also welcome to bring your own) and good music.

_title.all: Standing Up ‚Äî For The Nearest Distance

text_sinopse.en: In Standing Up ‚Äì For The Nearest Distance, Diogo Piment√£o explores the presence and absence of the human body through drawing and sculpture. Among other works, the exhibition presents real-size graphite drawings of the artist‚Äôs own hands: positioned up, down, and outstretched... placed precisely where his body would be in space, leaving only an apprehension of absence. Rather than depicting the body as an autonomous subject, the work highlights graphite as both material and mark, presence and residue. The hands drawn with graphite, covered in graphite become a kind of self-contained loop where the medium represents itself. The absence of the full figure further reinforces this idea: what remains is not the body, but the material that records its movement, suggesting a shift in representation. Framed individually, each hand becomes a marker of an invisible presence, marking both presence and absence. The series originates from a moment of self-observation: hands covered in graphite, the very medium that defines much of Piment√£o‚Äôs practice. By drawing his hands with the same material that stains them, the work creates a self-referential loop‚Äîa tool drawing the trace of its own use.
text_sinopse.all: Em Standing Up - For The Nearest Distance, Diogo Piment√£o explora a presen√ßa e a aus√™ncia do corpo humano atrav√©s do desenho e da escultura. Entre outras obras, a exposi√ß√£o apresenta desenhos a grafite das m√£os do artista em tamanho real: posicionadas para cima, para baixo, estendidas... colocadas exatamente onde o seu corpo estaria no espa√ßo, deixando a apreens√£o da sua aus√™ncia. Em vez de representar o corpo como um sujeito aut√≥nomo, a obra destaca a grafite como material e marca, presen√ßa e res√≠duo. As m√£os desenhadas com grafite, cobertas de grafite, tornam-se uma esp√©cie de circuito aut√≥nomo onde o medium se representa a si pr√≥prio. A aus√™ncia da figura completa refor√ßa ainda mais esta ideia: o que resta n√£o √© o corpo, mas o material que regista o seu movimento, sugerindo uma transposi√ß√£o na representa√ß√£o. Emolduradas individualmente, cada m√£o marca a posi√ß√£o de uma presen√ßa invis√≠vel, assinalando tanto a presen√ßa como a aus√™ncia. A s√©rie nasce de um momento de auto-observa√ß√£o: m√£os cobertas de grafite, o mesmo material que define grande parte da pr√°tica de Piment√£o. Ao desenhar as suas m√£os com o mesmo material que as mancha, o trabalho cria um ciclo autorreferencial - uma ferramenta que desenha o tra√ßo do seu pr√≥prio uso.

Cineasta e artista uzbeque que explora a complexa cultura da √Åsia Central, Saodat Ismailova √© autora de uma obra inspirada por mitos, rituais e hist√≥rias orais, frequentemente protagonizados por mulheres, revelando sistemas de conhecimento esquecidos pela modernidade globalizada.

text_sinopse.en: Inspired by the book A Inven√ß√£o da Natureza by Alexander von Humboldt, the German naturalist and explorer who more than two hundred years ago defined the Earth as a great living organism, we embark on an odyssey that travels the planet from end to end and, between sound, visual and sensory landscapes, helps us to realise the importance of cultivating a deep respect for nature.

text_sinopse.en:
‚í∂MO-TE [I love you] is the largest monographic exhibition by Francisco Tropa (Lisbon, 1968) ever staged. Known for his complex body of work that combines a broad range of mediums ‚Äî sculpture, drawing, performance, etching, photography and film ‚Äî and references, including figures from ancient and modern times, the arts, science and literature, the artist has, over the last thirty years, built his own world enriched by various traditions of sculpture, literature and mythology. These considerations are frequently founded on metaphysical questions, or anthropological and philosophical themes, more precisely on nature, the origin and the final purpose of art, and the creative act. 

The exhibition does not claim to be a retrospective, despite being assembled from key projects completed by the artist in each decade of his career. These include the ‚Äúprototypes‚Äù, produced mostly in the 1990s and early 2000s, presented on the mezzanine floor of the Serralves Library; A Assembleia de Euclides [The Assembly of Euclid], which occupied Tropa for much of the 2000s; and O Enigma de RM [The RM Enigma], his most recent work. The exhibition should be seen as a great ‚Äúmachine‚Äù systematically confronts visitors with some of the artist‚Äôs fundamental concerns, namely how artworks are legitimised, perceived, analysed and shared (should they be subject to a ‚Äúreading‚Äù? Should we judge them on what supposedly makes them topical, the appearance of contemporaneity?). The repetition of form, the reappearance of elements, and the recurrence of specific references (to the history of art ‚Äî ancient, modern and contemporary ‚Äî, to antiquity, and mythology) invites us to question our own notions of originality and creativity. Tropa has embraced the recourse to repetition and the reutilisation of elements from past works, rather than seek the new. The artist is more interested in continuing to add to an object, a motif or point of reference with which he consistently works: ‚ÄúI only come up with something new if I can‚Äôt make use of something I‚Äôve already worked with; repeating objects in different situations only serves to enrich them‚Äù. He also explores associations triggered by how we were exposed to these elements in the past. At the same time, the profusion of references ensures each piece is polyphonic, conveying a variety of different meanings simultaneously. Intentionally paradoxical, this multiplicity of possible interpretations ‚Äî what the artist calls ‚Äúcontrolled noise‚Äù ‚Äî ultimately results in an infinite capacity for ‚Äúreadings‚Äù of the work, with its interpretation based on an almost endless array of explicit, erudite citations that it inventories and/or summons. The point is to make it so that all visitors can do is ‚Äúsimply‚Äù look. 


‚í∂MO-TE, besides being a machine for creating echoes, referrals, resonances and reverberations, is a spectacle that questions and explores the very format of the exhibition itself. It presents projects that become exhibitions within the exhibition, emphasising the importance of the contexts in which the objects are displayed for achieving the intended reading. Beginning with the title, it places visitors at the centre of an experience where they are the true protagonists. A fitting riposte to the grand statement that provides the exhibition‚Äôs title could well be a phrase we usually associate with amours fous, but which, in this case, is an entirely appropriate commentary on the starring role granted the visitor: ‚ÄúWithout you, I am nothing!‚Äù

‚í∂MO-TE, organised by the Serralves Museum, is curated by Ricardo Nicolau and coordinated by Giovana Gabriel. The exhibition is a collaboration with the Nouveau Mus√©e National de Monaco, which will be presenting simultaneously another side to the work of Francisco Tropa.


_______________________________________________________________________


In recognition of the importance of the performative in Tropa‚Äôs practice, a presentation of the works A Marca do Seio / The Mark of the Breast and O Transe do Ciclista / The Cyclist‚Äôs Trance will take place every Tuesday (4 pm), Thursday (11 am), Friday (11 am) and Saturday (4 pm) for the entirety of the exhibition‚Äôs run. Besides this, during the weekend of November 9th and 10th, there will be a programme of performances put together by the museum‚Äôs Performative Arts Service in close collaboration with the artist, which shall take over a number of different spaces at Serralves, such as the Auditorium and Atrium (see the full programme below). This ‚Äúmarathon‚Äù of activities shall also include a talk in Serralves Library on the 9th (scheduled for 11 am) in which Francisco Tropa, Ricardo Nicolau (exhibition curator), C√©lia Bernasconi (curator of Tropa‚Äôs exhibition at the Nouveau Mus√©e National de Monaco), Simone Menegoi (essayist, and a long-time performer of Francisco Tropa‚Äôs work, also author of a number of texts for the exhibition catalogue which take an in-depth look at particular projects of his) and Kathleen Campagnolo (responsible for the management of Tropa‚Äôs archive during the preparatory stage of the exhibition, and for texts about most of the works featured in the book) will discuss the artist‚Äôs practice, and the vision behind the different exhibitions taking place in Porto and Monaco.

‚ÄúAmo-te‚Äù ("I love you") written with a circle around the A ‚Äì a direct reference to one of the most well-known anarchist symbols ‚Äì is inscribed on the facade of the Ant√≥nio Arroio Art School in Lisbon. Today, the phrase, with its added inflection, stands as one of the most visible synonyms for the values that the teaching and student communities proudly identify with. However, that was not always the case: the inscription was originally conceived by a group of students in the late 1970s and early 1980s who engaged in various activities outside the official school programs. Informally led by Pedro Vasconcelos (son of filmmaker Ant√≥nio Pedro Vasconcelos), the group spray-painted ‚ÄúAmo-te," with the circled A on walls inside the school. Additionally, one night, Pedro Vasconcelos ‚Äì who lived just five minutes from Ant√≥nio Arroio at the time ‚Äì reportedly painted the phrase, with the same symbol, on the school's facade. This action was accompanied and documented by two other group members, Miguel Cavaco and Jos√© de Almeida. Considered illegal by the school's board, the authors were threatened with disciplinary measures, though these threats that were not carried out thanks to the intervention of E.M. Melo e Castro, then a professor in the textile department. The graffiti was subsequently erased. Several years later, another student repainted the modified ‚ÄúAmo-te‚Äù on the facade. By then, the ethos of the school had changed substantially, largely due to a unique initiative in artistic pedagogy: the Atelier Livre (Open Studio). Spearheaded by the group of students responsible for ‚ÄúAmo-te‚Äù (and many other actions inside and outside the school) and teachers sympathetic to their desire to question the school's official curriculum ‚Äì namely Pedro Morais and Ant√≥nio Campos Rosado ‚Äì the Atelier Livre emerged from of the desire to create an alternative art education in Portugal.


Francisco Tropa attended Ant√≥nio Arroio between 1983 and 1986 and frequently acknowledges the influence of the Atelier Livre, then coordinated by Pedro Morais, on his artistic journey.
text_sinopse.all:
‚í∂MO-TE √© a maior exposi√ß√£o monogr√°fica de Francisco Tropa (Lisboa, 1968) alguma vez apresentada. Autor de uma obra complexa, que combina de forma surpreendente um amplo leque de meios (escultura, desenho, performance, gravura, fotografia e filme) e refer√™ncias (em que se destacam figuras dos mundos antigo e moderno, oriundas da arte, da ci√™ncia e da literatura), o artista construiu nos √∫ltimos 30 anos um universo muito pr√≥prio em que se evidenciam uma s√©rie de reflex√µes alimentadas por diferentes tradi√ß√µes da escultura, da literatura e da mitologia. Estas reflex√µes centram-se frequentemente em quest√µes metaf√≠sicas e temas antropol√≥gicos e filos√≥ficos, nomeadamente sobre a natureza, a origem e a finalidade da arte e do ato criativo. 


A exposi√ß√£o n√£o pretende ser uma retrospetiva, apesar de se organizar em torno de projetos do artista realizados em cada d√©cada do seu percurso, entendidos como momentos fundamentais da sua pr√°tica: os ‚Äúprot√≥tipos‚Äù maioritariamente produzidos nos anos 1990 e in√≠cio dos anos 2000, apresentados no mezanino da Biblioteca de Serralves, A Assembleia de Euclides, que o manteve ocupado durante grande parte dos anos 2000 e O Enigma de RM, o seu trabalho mais recente. A exposi√ß√£o deve ser entendida como uma esp√©cie de grande m√°quina, na qual ao longo do percurso o visitante √© sistematicamente confrontado com algumas das preocupa√ß√µes fundamentais do artista, nomeadamente a forma como as obras de arte s√£o legitimadas, percecionadas, analisadas e transmitidas. Dever√£o ser lidas? Dever-se-√° privilegiar o seu car√°ter supostamente atual, a sua apar√™ncia de contemporaneidade? A repeti√ß√£o de formas, o reaparecimento de elementos, a reincid√™ncia de determinadas refer√™ncias (√† hist√≥ria da arte ‚Äì antiga, moderna e contempor√¢nea ‚Äì, √† antiguidade, √† mitologia) apelam a que nos interroguemos sobre as no√ß√µes de originalidade e de criatividade. Francisco Tropa assume que, ao inv√©s de procurar o novo, prefere tirar partido da repeti√ß√£o e da reutiliza√ß√£o de elementos de obras antigas. Para o artista, √© mais interessante acrescentar informa√ß√£o a um objeto, motivo ou refer√™ncia com que trabalhe recorrentemente ‚Äì ‚Äús√≥ invento algo novo se n√£o puder usar alguma coisa com que j√° tenha trabalhado; repetir objetos em situa√ß√µes diferentes enriquece-os‚Äù ‚Äì, e explorar associa√ß√µes catalisadas por contextos de apresenta√ß√£o passados. Ao mesmo tempo, a pluralidade de refer√™ncias garante que cada trabalho seja sempre polif√≥nico, que diga simultaneamente v√°rias coisas diferentes. Intencional e paradoxalmente, esta multiplicidade de poss√≠veis interpreta√ß√µes ‚Äì este ‚Äúru√≠do controlado‚Äù, como lhe chama Tropa ‚Äì, pode conduzir a uma incapacidade de esgotar a ‚Äúleitura‚Äù da obra, a uma interpreta√ß√£o assente nas men√ß√µes mais ou menos inesgot√°veis, mais ou menos expl√≠citas, mais ou menos eruditas que arrola e/ou convoca. O objetivo: fazer com que reste ao visitante ‚Äúsimplesmente‚Äù ver.  


‚í∂MO-TE, al√©m de uma m√°quina potenciadora de ecos, reenvios, resson√¢ncias e reverbera√ß√µes, √© uma mostra que interroga e explora o pr√≥prio formato-exposi√ß√£o: porque apresenta projetos que s√£o aut√™nticas exposi√ß√µes dentro da exposi√ß√£o; porque enfatiza a import√¢ncia dos contextos em que os objetos s√£o apresentados para uma determinada leitura; porque, a come√ßar pelo t√≠tulo, posiciona o visitante no centro de uma experi√™ncia da qual √© o verdadeiro protagonista. Um adequado complemento √† declara√ß√£o que d√° nome √† exposi√ß√£o pode bem ser uma frase normalmente associada a amores desesperados, mas que, neste contexto, elucida exemplarmente o papel principal conferido ao espectador: ‚ÄúSem ti, eu n√£o existo!‚Äù


‚í∂MO-TE, organizada pelo Museu de Serralves, √© comissariada por Ricardo Nicolau e coordenada por Giovana Gabriel. Esta exposi√ß√£o monogr√°fica √© organizada em colabora√ß√£o com o Nouveau Mus√©e National de Monaco, que apresenta simultaneamente outra vertente da obra de Francisco Tropa. 


_______________________________________________________________________


Reconhecendo a import√¢ncia do car√°ter performativo da pr√°tica de Francisco Tropa, as pe√ßas A Marca do Seio e O Transe do Ciclista ser√£o ativadas todas as ter√ßas-feiras (16h00), quintas-feiras (11h00), sextas-feiras (11h00) e s√°bados (16h00) durante todo o per√≠odo da exposi√ß√£o. Esta ‚Äúmaratona‚Äù de atividades contempla ainda uma conversa na Biblioteca de Serralves (dia 9, pelas 11h) em que Francisco Tropa, Ricardo Nicolau (curador da exposi√ß√£o), C√©lia Bernasconi (curadora da exposi√ß√£o de Francisco Tropa no Nouveau Mus√©e National de Monaco), Simone Menegoi (ensa√≠sta, int√©rprete de longa data do trabalho de Francisco Tropa, autor de v√°rios textos para o cat√°logo da exposi√ß√£o que analisam determinados projetos em profundidade) e Kathleen Campagnolo (respons√°vel pela gest√£o do arquivo de Francisco Tropa durante a prepara√ß√£o da exposi√ß√£o e  pela escrita de textos que descrevem a maioria dos trabalhos que surgem no livro) discutir√£o a pr√°tica do artista, e as perspetivas que ter√£o orientado a conce√ß√£o das exposi√ß√µes no Porto e no M√≥naco.

‚ÄúAmo-te‚Äù, com um c√≠rculo em redor do A ‚Äì refer√™ncia direta a um dos s√≠mbolos anarquistas mais conhecidos ‚Äì, a palavra inscrita na fachada da Escola Art√≠stica Ant√≥nio Arroio (Lisboa), √© hoje um dos sin√≥nimos mais vis√≠veis de valores em que facilmente (e orgulhosamente) se reveem as comunidades docente e estudantil. Mas nem sempre foi assim: esta inscri√ß√£o foi originalmente pensada por um grupo de estudantes que, em finais da d√©cada de 1970 e in√≠cio da seguinte, desenvolveu v√°rias atividades paralelas aos programas oficiais da escola. Liderado informalmente por Pedro Vasconcelos (filho do cineasta Ant√≥nio Pedro Vasconcelos), o conjunto de estudantes pichou em determinadas paredes do interior da escola a palavra ‚ÄúAmo-te‚Äù, com o tal A circulado. text_sinopse.en:
In the context of the event of Simultaneous Openings in Miguel Bombarda on March 22nd, Tincal lab presents the individual exhibition by Ana Pina: ‚ÄúInvis√≠veis s√£o as linhas que nos prendem.‚Äù / ‚ÄúInvisible are the lines that bind us.‚Äù
We welcome you for a toast between 4pm and 8pm, with the presence of the artist. To visit until May 14th.


Invisible are the lines that bind us.
Drawing and Jewelry

On paper, the line and the word come together, between contour drawings and fragments of poetry. In jewelry, wires and chains hang the hands cut out of metal.
In reality, invisible are the lines that bind us.
And they all intersect.

The series of drawings was born out of chance and a certain fascination with hands, in 2004. The pretext was simple: to draw the left hand repeatedly. Minimalist line, essential. Sometimes a color of papers, brushes, frequently with words, always spontaneous.
About 20 years later, the drawings are cut out in metal, inspiring pieces of jewelry that are more than figurative repetitions. They allude to the complicity of the pair that touches or moves away, sustaining veins and connections, hiding secrets, imitating gestures, revealing metaphors.

It is they, the hands themselves, that create, write, draw, touch. They are the instrument, the force of expression and source of inspiration.
They make visible the lines that bind us.
And they all intersect.


Ana Pina (Portugal)
Ana Pina was born in 1980, in Porto, Portugal, city where she studied, still lives and works.
She graduates in architecture (FAUP, 2004) and works in an office for a few years, until she founds her passion for contemporary jewelry.
Jeweler and gallerist, she divides her work between the personal brand, launched in 2012, and Tincal lab, that is since 2015 an active contemporary jewelry workshop and exhibition space, featuring curated workshops with invited jewelers, individual and collective exhibitions, by local and international artists.
In her work Ana Pina combines the background in architecture with traditional jewelry techniques and contemporary concepts of design in the creation of jewels with a strong abstract and geometric inspiration.
Unique pieces or limited collections combine elements of a common vocabulary in a game of contrasts and textures, geometric relations and asymmetries, as if they were letters building words inserted in a bigger text.

No seu trabalho Ana Pina alia a experi√™ncia em arquitectura a t√©cnicas tradicionais de joalharia e conceitos contempor√¢neos de design na cria√ß√£o de pe√ßas com inspira√ß√£o marcadamente abstracta e geom√©trica.

text_sinopse.en:
About the artist: Vasco Mota (1999) is a graphic designer and urban sketcher. He graduated from ESAD Matosinhos. In 2021, he created the Rabiscar o Porto project, which aims to bring together people of all ages to illustrate the city in situ. In the meantime, the project was welcomed by the Municipality of Porto and has been present at several events. The urban sketcher takes his graphic diary with him wherever he goes and illustrates, using the watercolour technique, everything he sees, from simple houses, urban and natural landscapes, details of the spaces he visits and, of course, the heritage of the city of Porto.

About the exhibition: Porto de Cor is Vasco Mota's first exhibition dedicated solely to illustrations of the city of Porto. It is a hymn to the essence of the Invicta city. In addition to presenting illustrations of the city's most visible and well-known spaces, Vasco also aims to praise the ‚Äúhidden‚Äù Porto and presents ‚Äúscribbles‚Äù of spaces that maintain the authenticity of yesteryear.

Para al√©m de apresentar ilustra√ß√µes de espa√ßos mais vistos e conhecidos da cidade, Vasco pretende tamb√©m enaltecer o Porto ‚Äúescondido‚Äù e apresenta ‚Äúrabiscos‚Äù de espa√ßos que mant√™m a autenticidade de outrora.
