_title.all: [Serralves] - TENDO EM LINHA DE CONTO OS TEMPOS ATUAIS | JEAN-LUC GODARD - OBRA PL√ÅSTICA

text_sinopse.en:
For the first time, Jean-Luc Godard's career as a creator of still images is on view, ranging from his childhood to 2022. Most of Godard's visual works (paintings, drawings, notebooks, digital images), as well as family photographs taken by his mother Odile Monod, have never before been exhibited.


The title of the exhibition, ‚ÄòTenant conte des temps actuels‚Äô, [Keeping tale of current times] is taken from Film annonce du film ‚ÄòDr√¥les de Guerre‚Äô (1er Tournage) [Trailer of the Film That Will Never Exist: ‚ÄòPhony Wars‚Äô (2022)]. ‚ÄòIt was a question of no longer trusting the billions of diktats of the alphabet and giving back their freedom to the incessant metamorphoses and metaphors of a real language by returning to the locations of past shoots, while keeping tale of current times.‚Äô The superimposition between Tenant conte / Tenant compte (Telling [a tale] / Keeping tale) combines notions of fabrication and of accuracy; imagination and description; invention and attention ‚Äì in short, the requirements and resources of cinema in the face of reality.


In 1993, Jean-Luc Godard met Manoel de Oliveira for a major interview for Lib√©ration, appearing on the paper's cover on 4-5 September. In it, Oliveira uttered a phrase that haunted Godard's films and cinephiles ever since: ‚ÄòThat's what I like about cinema in general: a saturation of magnificent signs bathed in the light of their lack of explanation.‚Äô In 1998, Manoel de Oliveira dedicated a poem to Jean-Luc Godard, Yellow Dog, which ends with these lines: ‚Äòa peerless cinema / called Godard.‚Äô These literary exchanges culminate in a dialogue between films: Film Socialisme (2010) by Jean-Luc Godard can be seen as a response to Um Filme Falado (2003) by Manoel de Oliveira.
text_sinopse.all:
Pela primeira vez, apresenta-se o percurso de Jean-Luc Godard enquanto criador de imagens fixas, desde a sua inf√¢ncia at√© 2022. O t√≠tulo da exposi√ß√£o, Tendo em Linha de Conto os Tempos Atuais, prov√©m do plano 15 de Film annonce du film 'Dr√¥les de Guerres' (1er tournage) [Trailer do filme que nunca existir√° ‚ÄúGuerras de Mentira‚Äù] (2022). ‚ÄúTratava-se de deixar de confiar nos milhares de milh√µes de ditames do alfabeto, a fim de devolver a liberdade √†s incessantes metamorfoses e met√°foras de uma verdadeira linguagem, regressando aos locais de filmagem do passado, mas tendo em linha de conto os tempos atuais‚Äù. A sobreposi√ß√£o entre ‚Äúconto‚Äù e ‚Äúter em conta‚Äù combina fabula√ß√£o e exatid√£o, imagina√ß√£o e descri√ß√£o, inven√ß√£o e aten√ß√£o, em suma, as exig√™ncias e os recursos do cinema face ao real.


Em 1993, Jean-Luc Godard quis encontrar-se com Manoel de Oliveira para uma ampla entrevista publicada no jornal Lib√©ration, destacada na primeira p√°gina de 4 e 5 de setembro. Nela, Oliveira pronuncia uma frase que, desde ent√£o, assombraria os filmes de Godard e o mundo cin√©filo: ‚Äú√â, ali√°s, disto que gosto em geral no cinema: uma satura√ß√£o de signos magn√≠ficos banhados na luz da sua aus√™ncia de explica√ß√£o.‚Äù Em 1998, Manoel de Oliveira dedica um poema a Jean-Luc Godard, C√£o amarelo, que termina com estas linhas: ‚Äúum cinema sem par / chamado Godard‚Äù. Estas trocas liter√°rias culminariam num di√°logo entre filmes: n√£o poder√° Film Socialisme (2010) de Jean-Luc Godard ser visto como uma resposta a Um Filme Falado (2003) de Manoel de Oliveira?

Come and UnStitch Prejudices with us! This monthly meeting dedicated to the world of textiles seeks to explore new circular solutions through different textile techniques. Together, we will deconstruct preconceived ideas, promote creativity, mix tradition and technology to discover new ways of creating in a more sustainable way.

Caldeiraria is an art gallery that aims to promote the artistic practices that flourish in Porto and to make them accessible to a wide audience.

Located in the historic center of Porto, Caldeiraria emerges in 2023 from the opportunity to recover and revitalize a space in a building on Rua dos Caldeireiros administered by the confraternity ‚ÄòConfraria da Nossa Senhora da Silva‚Äô ‚Äî once managed by the city's blacksmiths, boilermakers, and fish hookers, the building used to be a Hospital , and from the desire to affect space to contemporary cultural production.

text_description.en:
The Galeria Municipal do Porto has a regular programme of exhibitions and events dedicated to the contemporary visual arts, also developing specific projects in design and architecture. With the mission of presenting exhibitions that reflect on recent trends in contemporary artistic and discursive production, we promote research, exchange and dissemination of ideas stimulating a debate surrounding the arts.

Since relaunching its institutional mission in 2014, the Galeria Municipal do Porto has worked with a wide range of national and international partners in the programming and commissioning of exhibitions, performances and discussions, also stimulating long-term engagement through its learning programmes and publications. It is part of the Contemporary Art Direction of √Ågora - Cultura e Desporto do Porto, E.M.

text_sinopse.en:
This year brings us the 8th edition of DDD and a special moment in our history - from here on, we celebrate freedom. In the certainty that there is always a before and after, this edition starts with the voice, the voices, to test other ways of being on stage, of experiencing dance in various spaces and formats. We redefine the limits of what dance can be, reformatting how it can be experienced. We rewrite narratives, unravelling how they can be shared and by whom.

More than ever, DDD sees itself as a festival that co-produces new creations, giving space to the teeming artistic community that lives in Portugal and bringing foreign artists here.

We're proud to say that we don't do this on our own: more and more, we work with partner venues and festivals, both inside and outside the country, so that each piece we present is also shown elsewhere, echoing. After all, revolutions are made collectively and on the move.

S√£o obras que brincam com as conven√ß√µes e prop√µem narrativas alternativas. Por detr√°s do trabalho vision√°rio de cada artista, acreditamos que o programa deste ano aborda as possibilidades radicais que abundam no mundo e a capacidade de a dan√ßa chegar ao p√∫blico para l√° da l√≠ngua, do sotaque e do dialeto. Seja qual for a motiva√ß√£o ou o feitio, vamos dan√ßar.

text_description.en:
AP'ARTE Contemporary Art Gallery, based in Porto, was founded in March 2010.

Since its inception, AP'ARTE Galeria's central premise has been the important reconciliation between presenting established artists, whose work is a clear reference on the contemporary art scene; and publicising young emerging artists, consistently supporting their projects and promoting opportunities to publicise their work.

AP'ARTE had the privilege of opening with a remarkable and symbolic exhibition by Nadir Afonso, which coincided with the celebration of his 90th birthday and had the honour of his presence, indelibly marking the beginning of this story. Since then, more than 100 solo and group exhibitions have been held, welcoming the most diverse forms, languages and artistic paths.

Inaugurated in October 1897, from the outset it was a venue for popular shows. At a time when it was almost exclusively used for showing films, the Secretary of State for Culture decided to rent it out at the end of the 1970s.

In September 1980, the Carlos Alberto National Auditorium opened its doors to host a more diversified programme. With the approach of the European Capital of Culture event, the building was acquired by Sociedade Porto 2001. Maintaining its symbolic value and updating the tradition of its use were the challenges taken on in the project signed by architect Nuno Lacerda Lopes.

After a troubled process of progress and setbacks, the renovated Carlos Alberto Theatre was finally returned to the city in September 2003.

text_sinopse.en:
With a career spanning four decades, Francis Al√øs (born 1959, Antwerp, Belgium) has forged a unique and radical practice ranging from painting and drawing to film and animation. Trained as an architect and urbanist in Belgium and Italy, Al√øs became interested in the civic role of the urban environment. He moved to Mexico City in 1986 where the rapidly transforming city and the consequent changes to social dynamics in the late 1980s inspired him to become a visual artist. 


Action is at the centre of Al√øs‚Äôs practice. He was the protagonist of most of his interventions in the 1990s, using his own body because it was immediately available. Children‚Äôs Games (1999‚Äìpresent) marks a clear shift: his agency was expanded and redistributed as children became the subjects. Taking its title from one of the earliest films in the series ‚Äì Children‚Äôs Game #2: Ricochets (2007) ‚Äì the exhibition emerges from the changing nature of participation in his practice, reflecting possibilities of collective consciousness and bodily agency. 


Complementing the expansive universe of Children‚Äôs Games, the exhibition presents some animation works, building on Al√øs‚Äôs interest in play through a focused exploration of hand games. Play is integrated and encouraged in the galleries through dedicated playrooms. 


The exhibition Ricochets is organized by Barbican, London with Funda√ß√£o de Serralves Museum of Contemporary Art, Porto and is curated by Florence Ostende.

text_description.en:
Built in 1325, the Casa do Infante is so named because Henry the Navigator was presumably born there.

The building, one of the oldest in the city, was probably also the largest in size, especially because of the two towers built in the 14th century, which have long since disappeared. The national monument has served different purposes over the years, such as a residence for official visits from the royal house, the city's old Customs House and the Mint, which had its offices there for several centuries.

text_description.en:
The Soares dos Reis National Museum has its origins in the Museum of Paintings and Prints and other Fine Arts objects, created in 1833 by King Pedro IV of Portugal. Known as the Museu Portuense, it was housed in the now defunct Convento de Santo Ant√≥nio da Cidade. In 1839 it passed to the direction of the Academia Portuense de Belas Artes, which organised a series of exhibitions that honoured notable artists such as Soares dos Reis, Silva Porto, Marques de Oliveira and Henrique Pous√£o, in successive generations of masters and disciples.

With the proclamation of the Republic, it was renamed the Soares dos Reis Museum in memory of one of the most outstanding names in Portuguese art. In 1932 it became the National Museum, a period marked by a significant reorganisation by Vasco Valente, incorporating objects from the Episcopal Palace of Porto (Mitra) and the Industrial Museum, as well as the deposit of collections from the now defunct Municipal Museum.

This was followed by the installation of the Museum in the Carrancas Palace where, as part of the 1940 National Commemorations, the exhibition The Work of Soares dos Reis was inaugurated. The Portuguese Institute of Museums marked the remodelling of the Soares dos Reis National Museum in 2001 with an architectural project by the studio of Fernando T√°vora, giving it new spaces for reserves, temporary exhibitions, an auditorium and an education service.

text_description.en:
Installed in a modernist building that was built in 1958, designed by Jos√© Carlos Loureiro, the Casa Marta Ortig√£o Sampaio was the result of a donation to Porto City Council in 1978, that opened to the public in 1996.

Marta Ortig√£o Sampaio (1897-1978), the daughter of Estela de Souza and Vasco Ortig√£o Sampaio, nephew of Ramalho Ortig√£o and a famous collector and patron from Porto, was the maternal niece of the painters, Aur√©lia de Souza and Sofia de Souza. She was born in a privileged context and came into contact with artistic practices from an early age.

Station 2 of the Porto City Museum evokes the living environment of this bourgeois family from Porto, presenting painting collection, a jewellery collection, a library specialising in art books, items of furniture of French, English and Indo-Portuguese influence and other decorative works of art.

The collection is constituted by the transfer of the furnishings, or part thereof, of the house where the couple lived in S. Mamede de Infesta ‚Äì Matosinhos. It is curious that the house on Rua de Nossa Senhora de F√°tima was never actually inhabited, indicating the secret intention of this construction, that was destined to be bequeathed to the city.

It is inscribed on the sound axis, which in the House enhances other readings and narratives in dialogue with the collection, and on the romantic axis, due to the persistence of the romantic spirit in the bourgeois taste of the first half of the 20th century.

The Casa Marta Ortig√£o Sampaio contains Portuguese naturalist works by Silva Porto, Carlos Reis, Malhoa, Roque Gameiro, among others, and an important collection of paintings, drawings and photographs by Aur√©lia de Souza, one of the most unique Portuguese artists of her time.

The important jewellery collection, one of the largest for personal use, includes nearly 300 items from the late 17th to the 20th century.

Flanking the house, in the garden, there are carved stones that belonged to the Convent of S. Bento de Av√©-Maria, a small lake and interesting flora, such as species of magnolias [magnolia grandiflora], and an Atlas Cedar [Cedrus atlantica] in the nature axis.

text_sinopse.all:
H√° um s√©culo atr√°s, no bairro do Harlem, em Nova Iorque, germinava o Renascimento do Harlem, um movimento que mudaria para sempre o cen√°rio art√≠stico e intelectual dos Estados Unidos da Am√©rica, cuja influ√™ncia rapidamente se estendeu ao panorama internacional.

Coincidindo com a Grande Migra√ß√£o, em que milh√µes de pessoas negras fugiram da viol√™ncia racial no Sul dos EUA, o movimento reuniu artistas, escritores, m√∫sicos e intelectuais na redefini√ß√£o da identidade afro-americana e na promo√ß√£o da cultura e do orgulho negros.

Uma explos√£o cultural que seria impulsionada por figuras-chave como Langston Hughes, W. E. B. Du Bois e Zora Neale Hurston (na literatura e no pensamento cr√≠tico), Duke Ellington, Billie Holiday e Ethel Waters (na m√∫sica), e Oscar Micheaux e Josephine Baker (no cinema), lan√ßando as bases para o futuro Movimento dos Direitos Civis. O Harlem Renaissance destacou-se tamb√©m como uma for√ßa de afirma√ß√£o e explora√ß√£o de quest√µes relacionadas com sexualidade e identidade, onde membros da comunidade LGBT, como Alain Locke, Ethel Waters e Langston Hughes desempenharam pap√©is fundamentais.

O Batalha prop√µe um retrato f√≠lmico do Harlem Renaissance e da sua influ√™ncia na contemporaneidade, arrancando com uma sess√£o que celebra o centen√°rio de Body and Soul, obra seminal de Oscar Micheaux protagonizada pelo ic√≥nico ator Paul Robeson, que ainda hoje permanece como um s√≠mbolo do ativismo contra a discrimina√ß√£o racial nos EUA. A sess√£o, apresentada pelo cineasta norte-americano Billy Woodberry, √© antecedida por uma curta-metragem da pioneira Zora Neale Hurston, escritora, antrop√≥loga e folclorista afro-americana. Tamb√©m a cineasta Akosua Adoma Owusu estar√° presente no Batalha para uma conversa sobre Du Bois e para apresentar a sua obra, por este influenciada. O programa, que vai desde a m√∫sica de Duke Ellington √† poesia de Langston Hughes, culmina com dois filmes, selecionados por Gisela Casimiro (escritora e ativista), protagonizados por Josephine Baker, figura ic√≥nica do s√©culo XX, que quebrou barreiras raciais ao tornar-se uma das primeiras mulheres negras a alcan√ßar notoriedade internacional no mundo da arte e do entretenimento.

text_sinopse.all:
"Sei das pedras parideiras h√° j√° muito tempo, mas s√≥ agora √© que elas atravessaram o meu caminho para me ajudar a gritar alto: Pedra que pariu!

text_sinopse_en.en:
I‚Äôve known about the birthing stones for a long time, but only now have they crossed my path to help me shout out loud: Pedra que pariu!

Beyond the simplicity of the materials and gestures that make up the pieces presented are several layers of different states of emotion and consciousness. There is also the harshness of the work that is done in silence, over a long period of time, and which claims nothing more than its bare existence ‚Äì to exist in order to be contemplated.

Immobile, rigid, granitic, and millenary, after centuries of invisible and silent work, the birthing stones also give birth.

In a place where you can find everything, what's worth taking home? In the midst of a truly endless world, how do you know what to buy and why? Early on one of these cold Saturday mornings, in order to find the best opportunities, we set ourselves the challenge of going to Vandoma with just 20 euros in our pockets. Between conversations and business deals, the opportunities we present here were discovered between minutes of chatting with those who make this place a meeting point every week - and a ritual in the diary. The Vandoma Fair takes place every Saturday between 8am and 1pm on Avenida 25 de Abril in Campanh√£.

text_sinopse.en:
The exhibition explores how scientists, philosophers, writers, artists and filmmakers represent plants for scientific study or enjoyment, creating herbaria of a scientific and poetic nature.

Through a multidisciplinary approach, the exhibition presents the exploratory work of various botanists and artists.

Outside, on the Porch of the Barn and Lagar, the work of Mario Alberto Pedraza is presented, who documented Colombian orchids based on the collections of Alexander von Humboldt (1769-1859) and Aim√© Bonpland (1773-1858), made at the beginning of the 19th century

In the Barn's contemplative space, visitors are invited to discover the impressive Grand Herbier d'Ombres/Grand herbarium of shadows by Lourdes Castro (1930-2022), presented in the installation Je/Eux d'Ombres by artist Claudia Isabel Navas. In this space, Philippe Durand surprises with Boscs, cyanotypes featuring various species of flora from contemporary French Mediterranean regions. This reflective journey is further enhanced by a corridor lined with yellow flowers from the Andes, photographed by Ram√≥n Laserna, and by the sound of excerpts from Jean-Jacques Rousseau's eight Lettres de Botanique [Letters on the Elements of Botany].

At the Lagar, the exhibition looks at the first techniques for representing plants, from hand-collecting during the botanical expeditions of the 18th century to plant prints, hand drawings and the first photographs. Here, illustrations from the Real Expedici√≥n Bot√°nica (1783-1816) are presented, led by Jos√© Celestino Mutis (1732-1808), who inspired Ram√≥n Laserna's reflections on the fragility of the natural world. His work follows in the footsteps of Mutis, who hosted Humboldt and Bonpland in Santa Fe de Bogot√° in 1801. In this space, there is also a video installation on Impressions de Plantes [Impressions of Plants], a herbarium containing the plants collected in the Americas by these historical figures.

The exhibition includes the Botany Photography Collection of the University of Coimbra, highlighting the contributions of figures such as J√∫lio Augusto Henriques (1838-1928). In addition, the unique watercolours of Portuguese orchids by Ursula Beau (1906-1984) celebrate Portuguese biodiversity.

text_sinopse.en:
"Portos. Portas. Pontes. is a multi-venue exhibition showcasing works by young Porto-based artists from around the world. Hosted in newly opened venues led by fellow expatriates, this initiative fosters artistic exchange between Porto‚Äôs expat and local communities, creating opportunities for cultural dialogue and collaboration. By transforming spaces into dynamic artistic environments, the project enriches the city‚Äôs creative scene and provides a platform for fresh perspectives.

Inspired by the journey of migration, the exhibition draws on the symbolism of ports, doors, and bridges to create opportunities for emerging artists, offering visibility and engagement for young expatriate talent. Ports connect us through art, welcoming new encounters. Doors open pathways to creativity and community. Bridges unite, fostering dialogue and collaboration.

Each participating venue offers a distinct theme, shaping an immersive experience for visitors through exhibitions, workshops, and events.

The exhibition will feature work by young international artists who each bring their unique stories and creative visions to life through diverse mediums: Nicolai Ganichev, Maxence Pons, Destiny, Vlad Aldohin, Yin Liu, Mulvaney, Anton Prokopev

All exhibited artworks are available for purchase."

Join us for a Generative Art Workshop with artist and creative coder Yin Liu.

This workshop introduces creative coding using the open-source JavaScript library P5.js. You will explore the history of generative and interactive art, learn fundamental P5.js commands, and use them to draw basic shapes.

At the end of the session, you‚Äôll get to code your face emoji.

No prior coding experience needed.
Bring your laptop ‚Äì everything else will be provided.

Yin Liu, a visual artist and creative developer from China, explores the intersection of analogue and digital media. With a background in game development and interactive art, she blends hand-drawn techniques with generative coding. Based in Porto since 2023, she creates work that navigates the boundary between human creativity and algorithmic design, while also teaching Creative Coding.
